fields.description:
When switching branches, you get "fatal: Unable to create 'C:/xxxx/.git/index.lock': File exists." However, click to switch branches again and the error goes away. This happens very frequently, but not in all cases. I've been able to reproduce with these step:
 # Double click on a local branch that has commits needing to be pulled.
 # Pull down the commits.
 # Double click on previous branch to go back. Error pops up.
 # Double click again, it works and switches branches.

This started happening after the last major update (months ago).
fields.summary: Switching branches fails on first try.

fields.description:
When pulling or fetching, nearly every single time faced with "Unable to update local ref"
Each time I have to go to the terminal and execute these lines to do what I need,
git gc --prune=now
git remote prune origin
git pull
Only then am I able to pull to my branch.  Have not been able to stop this from happening.  I'm the only one out of about 100 who are pulling from the same repository that has this constant problem.
fields.summary: Unable to solve constant "Unable to update local ref" issues

fields.description:
On a repository with many branches, it can be difficult to see which commits belong to which branches when scrolling down in the commit history. See for example this screenshot:

!sourcetree-branches-feature-request.png!

The yellow and green branches' heads are in the visible area, so these are good. However, the blue and pink branch are more recent, so we just see as they appeared back then, but we do not see which branch is which.

This could be resolved by displaying the labels of the blue (B) and pink (P) branch at the top of the list, in their respective color.

This gets a bit complicated if there are merges. For example, if the pink branch (P) gets merged into the blue branch (B), this could be visualized by showing the labels

[B] in blue color
[P, B] in pink color

which indicates to the user that what he sees as blue commits are only part of the [B] branch, but what he sees as pink commits are present in both the [B] and the [P] branch.

Of course, this gets messy quickly if there are many branches present.

Maybe a more simple version of this feature would be a tooltip over the commit dots. If the user hovers a commit, SourceTree could display the labels of those branches that contain the respective commit.
fields.summary: Show branch labels when scrolling down

fields.description:
Yesterday, 10/20/2016, from my Desktop machine, I finally accommodated the update Source Tree keeps pinging me with, every time I open it.  I was previously running version 1.6.14.

I also was prompted about a security issue with the mercurial, so I allowed SourceTree to run the update to Mercurial 3.7.3.

We integrate with Stash repositories.  After the upgrade, Source Tree would still connect with Stash to indicate branch status in relation to the repository, but when trying to pull the latest updates to the branch, it would not connect correctly (Stash would disconnect for authentication failures that there was a problem with my PublicKey).

I proceeded to test my connection from Source Tree on my laptop, which was still running the prior version (1.6.14) and it worked just fine.  So I tried refreshing my keys on my desktop with the copies from my laptop and my desktop still wouldn't successfully connect for a Pull.

So I tried generating new keys on my desktop and still no luck, meanwhile, my laptop still was working fine.  So I again tried reverting back to my original keys from my laptop and still no luck.

This morning, I uninstalled version 1.9.6.1 from my desktop, located the prior download installer for 1.6.14 and re-installed the old version to my desktop.  Without having to make any configuration changes to my desktop - I reattempted the pull and it successfully completed.  I also just checked and my desktop is still using the updated Mercurial as well (3.7.3).

So the new version 1.9.6.1 is somehow corrupting the publickey when passing it to Stash - either as a newly introduced problem in this version of the software (again, this is my first attempt at updating SourceTree) or there is a problem when upgrading from 1.6.14 directly to 1.9.6.1 that is corrupting the handling of the PublicKey.
fields.summary: Update 1.9.6.1 from 1.6.14 breaks integration with Stash
Number of commits should be on the left of each branch's name under Branches list.

fields.description:
SourceTree crashed during update installation. Re-ran update successfully, but SourceTree can no longer open existing local repositories and gives the following error message:

{code}
'git status' failed with code 128: fatal: unable to access
'N:\/.config/git/config': Invalid argument
(C:\Users\<folder_name>
{code}

git fsck --full shows that repository is fine. Both System Git and Embedded Git does not work well, but Git Bash shows the repository as intended. Which means possibly the issue is with SourceTree.
fields.summary: Cannot open existing repository after crash during SourceTree update

fields.description:
Per STSP-5205:

Staged files are automatically unstaged when clicking on down arrow next to folder to reduce files shown

Unstaging Files
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false reset -q – <path_removed>
fatal: Unable to create '<path_removed>'.git/index.lock': File exists.

If no other git process is currently running, this probably means a
git process crashed in this repository earlier. Make sure no other git
process is running and remove the file manually to continue.
fields.summary: Unstaging Files when minimizing tree view

fields.description:
The file list in the "File Status" and "Log / History" tabs are showing inconsistant behaviour.
Some files are being shown including the complete path and some have the path truncated and showing elipsis instead.
There doesn't appear to be any pattern to when the elipsis is shown and it is shown at different parts of the path.
As there is no clear pattern, it would appear to be a bug.
If the elipsis is desired functionality, it should be consistant and probably optionally turned off.
fields.summary: File lists truncated and showing elipses (...)

fields.description:
When in the process of a merge with conflicts, SourceTree does not indicate that a merge is in progress.  As soon as you open the terminal, it immediately indicates "MERGING" but in SourceTree this information isn't shown.

I started a merge operation and decided I didn't want to complete the merge.  Incorrectly, I simply discarded all the merge changes and went on with my business, assuming the merge was aborted.  As it turns out, the merge was still in progress and my next commit was not as intended.

Additionally, there is no "Abort Merge" menu item.  I saw SRCTREE-3683 which indicates the same issue for Mac.
fields.summary: Make the process of merging more prominent

fields.description: Windows 10, each time I select a file for see the diff, it is unselected without prior advice... so I can't never see my diffs again!
fields.summary: Autorefresh unselects files

fields.description:
It is simple enough, sourcetree keeps crashing after each and every GIT commit I make.

The commit itself is done properly.

Please let me know any further information you'd need to start the investigation.
fields.summary: Not responding (crash) right after GIT commit

fields.description:
Im tryiing to use Androdi studio as external Diff and Merge Tool in Sourcetree. But it is never opened.

The global gitconfig looks nice:
[difftool "sourcetree"]
	cmd = 'c:/Program Files/Android/Android Studio/bin/studio64.exe' diff $LOCAL $REMOTE

[mergetool "sourcetree"]
	cmd = 'c:/Program Files/Android/Android Studio/bin/studio64.exe' merge $LOCAL $REMOTE $BASE $MERGED
	keepbackup = false
	trustExitCode = true
fields.summary: Source Tree does not execute Custom Diff or Merge Tool

fields.description:
See: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/STSP-5114

When a non-standard SSH URI is used in ST, it ends up in a "forever loading" type state. The only workaround seems to be cloning / updating from the command-line, but it isn't the most efficient way around this
fields.summary: SourceTree does not auto-update when non-standard URIs are used

fields.description:
While using Git repositories, on commit the program successfully enters the commit, but crashes.

Push works fine.
fields.summary: Crashes on commit of git repository

fields.description:
It seems impossible to get an older version from GitHub using SourceTree, without setting that version as current.. which would be disastrous.

Perhaps this is an error, 

If I select multiple files I can only select "Open Current Version" and if I do it opens in default application, 

If I right click on a single file I can select "Open Selected Version", it tries to open in default application, but with wrong parameters.

(please do not ask why I need this, a long story, but I do.. and a simple task when I was using Tortoise with SubVersion)
fields.summary: Retrieve specific version

fields.description:
I am getting below error after installing SourceTree.exe version 1.9.6.

There is no any folder created at C:\Users\<UserName>\AppData\Local\Atlassian yet becasue it never opened after installation.

Error 1:

Application: SourceTree.exe
Framework Version: v4.0.30319
Description: The process was terminated due to an unhandled exception.
Exception Info: System.InvalidOperationException
   at System.Windows.Application.set_ShutdownMode(System.Windows.ShutdownMode)

Exception Info: System.Windows.Markup.XamlParseException
   at System.Windows.Markup.XamlReader.RewrapException(System.Exception, System.Xaml.IXamlLineInfo, System.Uri)
   at System.Windows.Markup.WpfXamlLoader.Load(System.Xaml.XamlReader, System.Xaml.IXamlObjectWriterFactory, Boolean, System.Object, System.Xaml.XamlObjectWriterSettings, System.Uri)
   at System.Windows.Markup.WpfXamlLoader.LoadBaml(System.Xaml.XamlReader, Boolean, System.Object, System.Xaml.Permissions.XamlAccessLevel, System.Uri)
   at System.Windows.Markup.XamlReader.LoadBaml(System.IO.Stream, System.Windows.Markup.ParserContext, System.Object, Boolean)

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Error 2:

Report Id: 6c12a78a-9201-11e6-8686-b8763fde6b1d
fields.summary: Sorce Tree not getting open after installation 1.9.6.1 version

fields.description:
After merging 2 branches (related to SRCTREEWIN-6441) I could not resolve conflicts using options 'resolve with mine' or 'resolve with theirs', it says the file is locked, by who?! Only sourcetree is open, no intelij/eclipse or other program that checks the files
doing this for multiple files at the same time is not working either, it worked yesterday on 1.8 version.
fields.summary: Error resolving conflicts

fields.description:
After merging 2 features with (expecting) conflicts, I got 180 conflicts, this list is too big to source tree display on comment box.
Since the comment area doesn't have a scroll, the text area expand and occupy all screen area available, leaving no room to see more than ~50 lines and completely hide the pannels stage/unstaged files.
The solution was to cute this huge text to another place and automatically the screen got to its normal size.
fields.summary: Merging features with conflict create unexpected behaviour on SourceTree

fields.description:
Since an update (sorry I don't know for which versions it was working) I have the problem that dobuleclicking files (e.g. .txt files) will not open Notepad automatically. If I right click and select "Open Current Version" it is working fine and Notepad is started.
 I am using this feature only in "Lg/History" view for single files.

is there any fix for this behavior?
fields.summary: Notepad will not be opened after doubleclicking files

fields.description:
From STSP-5165

"All of our systems are operating in live environments, and our development style involves two different types of maintenance.
Larger maintenance projects are branched and get worked in offline - these are often larger commits and less frequent.
We also have small maintenance tasks that apply immediately to the live system, often fixing small bugs in the code. When operating on these we fix a bug and commit the code, however we then notice another problem becomes apparent having pushed this change to the live system, so we have to make an additional change. When we come to commit this second change we want to use the same commit comment as used on the previous commit (as they often refer to the same support task being worked on).
If there a way we can recall a short list of recent commit comments and select the one appropriate to this commit?
If there isn't would you be able to add one in please?"
fields.summary: Feature request: Select default / recent commit comments

fields.description:
I have a couple of submodules setup with fetchinclude configuration for lfs, and whenever I open the submodules with SourceTree I get the popup asking to run git lfs pull, presumably to download everything that is excluded.

Pressing Yes runs it and does nothing, but the popup comes back if I close/open the submodule.

It's also problematic when you have a couple of bookmarks of submodule like this, you get the popup for each of them on startup.
fields.summary: Git-Lfs submodule with fetchinclude configuration always asks to download content

fields.description:
Unable to resolve merge conflict if local file was deleted.
Resolve using mine fails.
Launch external merge tool fails (araxis\winmerge).
fields.summary: Unable to resolve merge conflict if local flie was deleted

fields.description:
I am experiencing the following error: 
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false push -v --tags origin master:master
remote: abort: the account owner has exceeded their user limit - write access is disabled to the repository.
fatal: unable to access 'https://ayazquraishi@bitbucket.org/arbisoftintuit/mock_lms.git/': The requested URL returned error: 402
Pushing to https://ayazquraishi@bitbucket.org/arbisoftintuit/mock_lms.git

We have upgraded our bitbucket to allow for additional users but I am still receiving this error.
fields.summary: Receiving 402 Errors Even After BitBucket Upgrade

fields.description:
There are several menus where a "External Diff" command appears. I am not talking about the one in the main menu, under Actions, but the one on a button showing a gear icon, when viewing the Log/History. The icon appears on the far right, and contains other commands such as "Ignore Whitespace" and "Lines of context".

The problem with the "External Diff" command in that menu is that it acts as a Checkbox, with no apparent behavior behind that. In the Mac version, however, the same menu entry is actually doing the same as the Actions menu's command: It launches the external diff viewer.

So, there's two things wrong here:
1. Choosing the gear menu's "External Diff" command does not launch the external diff viewer as expected.
2. It adds a checkbox to the menu, and selecting the command again does not uncheck it, which is also unusual.
fields.summary: "External Diff" menu command not behaving like in OS X version

fields.description:
Clicking 'stop tracking' on file.
Button Cancel works as OK button. Ok button works as cancel.
fields.summary: Stop tracking dialog box

fields.description:
I'm trying to discard all the changes done on my working copy.
To do so, I'm using the 'discard...' option from the working copy, then the 'reset all' option.

Since few days, I notice the ongoing git comment is no more cleaned, especially when I am trying to discard an ongoing merge conflict resolution.  
 !2016-10-12 09_55_20-SourceTree.png|thumbnail! 

I feel no more confident in this 'reset all' option as it should also delete none visible data like the merge status metadata
fields.summary: Reset all option is no more cleaning the ongoing git commit

fields.description:
Files path in "working copy" tab (unstaged files) is not consistent. 
Some file path is shown like : /parent_dir/.../filename.extension
but, some files shows full path.
fields.summary: File path is not consistent in "working copy"

fields.description:
Seems that the form page does not scale by resolution.  Therefore, if you do not have a large enough resolution, the options form cuts off, and you cannot scroll through it.

See screenshot - tested on 1366x768 resolution.
fields.summary: Form for SourceTree options too long for certain resolutions.
Git file tree refresh hangs when using embedded GIT.

fields.description: Default selected button to "OK" within action (i.e. delete, discard, etc) dialogs (and not cancel). Otherwise the mouse needs to be used to click OK (Alt + O does not work).  See attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Default selected button to "OK" within action dialogs (and not cancel).

fields.description:
The ability to customize the GUI settings adding how many abbreviation bytes are necessary for show git commit SHA.

By default Sourcetree uses 7bytes, but I need to use 9bytes
fields.summary: Git log abbrev from 7 bytes to custom number

fields.description:
The General tab in the Options window is higher than a standard 1366x768 screen making it partially invisible. The window can't be resized. The window should be resizable (at least height-wise) and scrollable.

Also, there's an apparently unused section with the label Misc in the General tab.
fields.summary: Options window too big

fields.description:
Quite a while back SourceTree's commit dialogue was replaced with the commit panel on the bottom of the window in the File Status tab. It uses a lot of screen space when trying to manage many changes or viewing a long diff in the right-hand side panel. Especially when using a small resolution such as my laptop's 1366x768.

I suggest adding an option to collapse/hide/resize it when you're not writing a commit message. Clicking the collapsed panel or the commit button would restore it.
fields.summary: Hide commit panel

fields.description:
Got 7 repositories on SourceTree. Switching between them results in SourceTree freezing for some tens of seconds. This started in this or recent versions, didn't exist before. CPU usage on the machine stays under 10% and most RAM is available. No HD activity is noticed.

See comments below, seems the spellchecker is responsible for it, even though I'd assume spellchecker should only be used when needed, guess something is wrong there.
fields.summary: SourceTree freezes under Windows10 (spellchecker issue)

fields.description: Microsoft has released their Desktop App Converter (see https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/bridges/desktop) that allows Win32 apps to be published in the Windows Store. It would be great to be able to install and update SourceTree from the Windows Store.
fields.summary: Add SourceTree to the Windows Store

fields.description:
1. Install SourceTree on Windows.
2. Install second git client (e.g. smartgit).
3. Read SourceTree tutorial to the point where you click the "Clone in SourceTree" button in the browser.
Problem1: It launches the second get client due to file association.
4. Uninstall second git client and try again.
Problem2: Windows says you have no program to open it, suggests Windows Store.
5. Uninstall/re-install SourceTree, and try again.
Problem3: Windows still says you have no program to open it!
fields.summary: "Clone in SourceTree" button fails

fields.description: When selecting (checkbox) files in Log / History window on Uncommitted changes, clicking Commit resets those selections. This one is rather frustrating on large commits.
fields.summary: Checkbox selection not remembered in Uncommitted changes

fields.description: During commit, or any file operation, you cannot check off multiple checkboxes when selecting files. The multiselect files should also affect the selection of checkboxes.
fields.summary: Multi-select checkboxes in Commit

fields.description:
Since the updated minimalist look SourceTree received (which is really good I must say), most buttons don't respond to Tab presses. This is a pretty major inconvenience.
It would be great if you could bring that back.

Thanks :)
fields.summary: Tab-responsive buttons

fields.description:
I have about 50 Repositories pulled on my PC. It is very hard to find the one in the repository list.

I'd like a little serach field on top/bottom of the list to quickly find a repository.

I don't like directories because Sourcetree sometimes crashes after some update and I have to delete the UserData Directory to get it working again - so my bookmarks are gone.
fields.summary: Filter for the repository list

fields.description:
It would be great to let user fetch a branch that is not checkout'ed. 

It is an important point to avoid unnecessary changes in your workspace files when you want to merge master into your checkouted branch and your local master is older than your checkouted branch. 

Note that sometimes, changes in code may lead to long lasting rebuilds.

Right now, I manage to get this done with this workaround:

Opening console and writing:

git fetch origin master:master

But it would be great to have this functionality directly as a context menu option.
fields.summary: Let user fetch other branch with no need to checkout that branch

fields.description:
When I try and add my bitbucket users I try my password and get the error message
Reference to undeclared entity 'mdash'. Line 8, position 42.
fields.summary: can't log into bitbucket

fields.description:
When selecting the next line to discard quickly enough after the previous one, the "discard line" button turns into "discard hunk" right before I click it. It takes about a half second, which is more than enough for a reasonably quick developer like myself and many people reading this ;)

So sometimes I end up discarding a whole hunk instead of just the line I've selected.

After *discarding a line AND something like 500ms*, the selected line gets cleared. And that's why this problem is happening.

So I just accidentally discarded something I shouldn't have. Brilliant.
Setting this bug to high priority as it may cause loss of work.
fields.summary: Discard line does discard hunk

fields.description:
1. Open servers.com
2. On the "Company" menu click "Legal" button.
3. Click on dropdown menu "Legal Information"
fields.summary: On the legal information page, at the drop-down information menu, displayed only induced button.

fields.description:
Selecting changed lines in working copy view doesn't work as expected with shift button pressed. 

Action:
* Select row N
* Select row M with shift pressed
Expected:
Rows from min(N, M) to max(N, M) are selected
Actual:
For N > M rows from M to N - 1 and row N + 1 are selected

In example(see attached image) N is 311, M is 310
fields.summary: Selecting changed lines with shift pressed doesn't work as expected
SourceTree crashes when clicking commit button

fields.description:
I notice with my coworkers when they are working with SourceTree (for the first time) that it's sometime difficult for them to understand what the branch is that belongs to a line in the graph column.

Therefore I think it would be a great help if a mouse over on the graph would show a small message telling what the corresponding branch name is. I created a small example of what this might look like, see the attachment "Example mouse over.png"
fields.summary: Show branch name on mouse over graph

fields.description:
I've reported two different issues in the last version of SourceTree for Windows.

1) In attached "menu bar issue" picture I show you the issue on different button without labels. The functionality of these button is ok, but the labels are not shown.

2) In attached "missing details" I show you a problem that i've reported different times after a merge of two branches. Sourcetree show a long list of files as result of merge but only few of these have the details. Furthermore, I've checked the files without details are files merged in previous commits and it seems Sourcetree continues to show them.
fields.summary: Visualization / UI issues with SourceTree Windows

fields.description: On installing the latest SourceTree, I was prompted about importing an SSH key. The instructions mention a 'No' button but the only buttons are 'Yes' and 'Cancel.'
fields.summary: Mismatch between SSH Key instructions and interface buttons

fields.description:
Well, it seems so strange to me that this does not work :|
While in menu bar, when I click "View -> Show/Hide Bookmarks", nothing happens.
I can't managed bookmark, even CTRL+B won't work.
I tried even running SourceTree in admin mode, or reinstalling it, without solving.
fields.summary: Bookmarks bar does not appear

fields.description: If there are any changed files, that were also moved to another location inside of a project - SourceTree can show differences for them, but for unknown reason "External diff" context menu item is disable for them.
fields.summary: External diff cannot be run on moved files

fields.description:
It is happen durinng instalation, on screen where you can enter credentials to your repository provider.

Reproduce steps:
1. Run installer
2. Go to Connect an account step
3. Fill username and password field
4. Switch to other provider.
5. Password hasn't been cleaned.
fields.summary: Password hasn't been cleaned on switch to other repository provider during instalation

fields.description:
The commit details should provide a hyperlink URL to auto open the commit in browser.

it ease user to view the full commit especially when the commit are huge, as well as help in sharing commit link across websites.
fields.summary: Enable hyperlink option inn commit details

fields.description:
I have a new file that will not show any content in the File Content window.
 if I remove the last 4-5 lines of code then it will show up. If I then add back in the closing brakes '}' then it will still work. However! as soon as I adding (on line 99) *private readonly* it stops working.

I've added the file to the repo, hoping then it would show up but still nothing. I've verified that Visual Studio 2015 update 3 can see the file just fine by using the History command and viewing the historical file contents.

Attached is the file that is causing the issue.
fields.summary: File contents window stops working...

fields.description: A check box in the options menu to enable/disable this feature would be good.
fields.summary: Create Pull Request automatically pushes to Git Server if not on the same level.

fields.description: I'm using the latest version of SourceTree, and for a while now it has been very slow to start, slower than Visual Studio 2013 on the same machine. Today, it took 1 minute and 44 seconds to start (complete log of startup, at DEBUG log level, attached)
fields.summary: Very slow to start

fields.description:
Screenshot: [https://www.dropbox.com/s/sjvj4nf6ripi794/Screenshot%202016-09-29%2012.50.08.png?raw=1]

 The close button in the screenshot cannot be activated by the keyboard:
 * 99% of the time it's not in the tab order so you cannot give it the keyboard focus
 * Enter key does not fire it
 * Space key does not fire it
 * It has no & keyboard shortcut so there is no Alt-key combination to fire it

With the increased screen sizes and resolutions hitting it with the mouse takes more and more time.

This besides the fact that for mouse-challenged people it won't work at all (hence high priority).

Similar issues likely hold for other buttons as well since SourceTree for Windows does their own sort-of-model-form "dialog" handling.

--jeroen
fields.summary: "Close" button on "staging files" sort-of-dialog not activatable by keyboard

fields.description: Double clicking a branch in the side bar cause the index.lock error, double clicking a second time seems to clear it and complete .
fields.summary: Double clicking a branch in the side bar cause the index.lock error.
Sidebar cannot populate more than 100 emote branches.

fields.description:
# Create local branch with name different than remote branch
 # right click local branch in Tree, set to track remote branch (with different name)
 # Right click again, verify tracking branch is set correctly
 # commit a change to the local branch
 ## note the tree view shows 1 waiting commit to be pushed
 # Click 'Push' button on toolbar
 # Note the local branch doesn't have upstream set, even though the treeview showed it and tracked the pending commit
fields.summary: Push dialog doesn't remember upstream settings

fields.description:
# Create a Branch with name that doesn't match upstream name (eg: {{branch1}}, but {{--set-upstream}} to {{origin/branch2}})
 # Commit changes, notice that {{Push changes immediately to}} is not set to show the upstream mapping for the branch. instead it shows {{-}} as the target branch
 # Check the box to Push changes, and a new branch is auto-created on {{origin}} which matches the name of the local branch, instead of pushing to the branch to which you've {{set-upstream}} for the local branch.
fields.summary: "Push changes immediately" doesn't respect upstream setting

fields.description:
Following these instructions: [http://stackoverflow.com/questions/17604232/edit-a-commit-message-in-sourcetree-windows-already-pushed-to-remote] removes the line of the message the edit was made on instead of updating it.
 # Create several commits on a local branch
 ## Give the commit messages multiple lines
 # Right click on an early one and select rebase children...interactively
 # Select the bottom commit in the new dialog and click Edit Message
 # Edit the first line of the message and click OK
 # Click ok on the rebase dialog.

Expected Result: The new message is in the commit, visible in the Lob/History tab

Actual Result: if there where more than one line in the commit with the edited message, the line that was edited is now missing. If there was only one line, the rebase fails on that commit because of an "empty commit message" I believe this is major because if I hadn't tried it on a test branch my message would have been lost.
fields.summary: Edit Message in Interactive Rebase erases message instead!

fields.description: When I switch between tabs or klick on commit button the source tree app completely get stuck and there is no reaction for about 15s. Then it just works fine again.
fields.summary: GUI get stuck for >15s for some actions

fields.description: Checked or unchecked "Create a new commit even if fast-forward is possible" option seems to not making difference. If there is no conflicts, a new commit is always created.
fields.summary: Merge is always commited

fields.description:
# Open SourceTree with many tabs 
# Click to close icon on current tab
# UI no reaction (sometime ~ 1 min)

[Video reproduce|http://screencast.com/t/u7T1YAax1Vij]
fields.summary: So slow close current tab (repository) ~ 1 min

fields.description:
Hi,

without seeing that there was another existing stash, I used the same name for another stash.
I was expecting to get an error for a duplicate name or at least get 2 different stash with the same name.
But in this case I got another stash entry, but if I select one of them, both are selected.

How to reproduce the issue:
1) Edit a file and create a stash with a name of your choose
2) Edit another file and create another stash with the same name of before
3) Try to select one of the two stashes, both of them will be selected and the diff preview will list the sum of the stash content.

Is this a wanted behaviour?
fields.summary: Wrong handling of different stashes with same name

fields.description:
Everytime we run the build process for our web application, and it generates a minified CSS file, SourceTree adds it to the unstaged files section despite the file explicitly being named in the .gitignore file.

It also has a weird rendering issue when trying to show the difference between subsequent versions of these minified files.

Happens on two seperate repos with similar configurations
fields.summary: Minified CSS files not ignored correctly

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1) add some file to to stage
2) click on it
3) select one line within preview area
4) click "Unstage lines" button
Result: file in staged area remain selected but preview will show unstaged version of it.
Expected result: preview will continue to show staged version of the file. It's consistent with the selection that is left on the file in the staged area. And it's much more convenient in case you would like to unstage multiple lines or hunks.

Another unexpected behaviour that's look like related to the previous one.
Steps:
1) make some changes in file and stage it
2) click on it in staged area. It will be shown in preview.
3) make some more changes in the file
4) press F5
Result: preview will show unstaged version while cursor will remain on file in staged area.
Expected: preview will not change
fields.summary: Unexpected preview switching from staged to unstaged version

Anoying Authenticate Popups

fields.description: If I select a file in the unstaged area, the stage selected button is only clickable for a moment, then becomes light gray and unclickable again. This creates a frustrating workflow of having to "stage all" and unstage the unwanted files.
fields.summary: Stage selected unselectable

fields.description: In version 1.9.6.1, the remote branches only list alphabetically A through M, any branch after that shows up briefly, then disappears before I can click on it. This makes checking out a branch very frustrating and at times impossible.
fields.summary: branches disappearing from remote view
fksite
Crashes very often especially during Push

fields.description:
At open and during other points of operation, the branch tree does not display all branches or folders at certain levels. To get them to show, I need to click to expand/collapse a folder a couple times to get the folders to show up. F5 does not seem to help.

Note -- this repo has dozens of branches, organized into folders/subfolders/sub-subfolders.

I've attached a video demonstrating what I ran into -- hope that helps with troubleshooting.

Thanks again for a great product - such a useful tool.
fields.summary: Only seeing 1 or 2 subfolders/branches at some levels, have to expand/collapse a couple times to show

fields.description:
We are using SourceTree to connect to a GIT repository on Visual Studio Team Services. With default encoding set (UTF-8), our commit messages looks right when Danish characters are included (æ, ø, å), but the diff window shows "?" symbols if the tracked files contains Danish characters:

*UTF-8:*

  !UTF8-Committed.jpg!

 

If we change ST to use text encoding Windows-1252, the characters look correct in the file diff window, but all commit messages now contain incorrect characters. This applies both to commits made before and after default encoding has been changed (and ST has been closed and re-opened in between):

*Windows-1252:*

!Win1250-Committed.jpg!

As an extra bug, it seems that when set to Win-1252, it is only respected in the Diff window once the change have been staged. Unstaged changes still contains "?":

*Unstaged:*

!Win1250-BeforeStage.jpg!

*Staged:*

!Win1250-Staged.jpg!

 

This bug seems related to [SRCTREEWIN-1048|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-1048], but that feature request should not be necessary for encoding to respected in all ST windows.
fields.summary: Incorrect encoding in Git Commit message

fields.description:
Warnings for adding or removing files seem to have no maximum length or size. In my case I can't even press the okay button, because the window is too large.

An easy solution would be to cap the information after some length and add information about the other elements, like so:

Assets/text.txt
Assets/text2.txt
Assets/text3.txt
Assets/text4.txt
...
And 24 other files
fields.summary: Warnging windows with maximum length

fields.description: It is not possible to execute a command --close-branch for Mercurial repositories. I certainly can do it in CMD but there is still more pleasant not to apply for such a trifle to other instruments.
fields.summary: --close-branch for Mercurial
GUI does not reflect state

fields.description:
We can see the changes done within a folder, but we can't stage the folder itself. We'll either need to stage all, or stage files one by one.

!stage.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Customer Report: SourceTree cannot stage folder.

fields.description:
Sourcetree should ensure that a new install for a cloud-based repository allows the user to maintain the system setup (including the history of his/her clones, branches, commits, etc.) as if it were on a single computer. If users install an upgrade to an application on their computer, we would expect that post-upgrade our setup remains and we can continue working as before. 

I think the same standard ought to apply to a cloud-based application, especially one that has significant business impact
fields.summary: Customer request: Sourcetree should ensure that a new install for a cloud-based repository allows the user to maintain the system setup as if it were on a single computer.

fields.description: It states click 'No' but no is not an option. I don't really need a follow up, I just thought you should know.
fields.summary: Load SSH Key prompt has incorrect wording.

fields.description:
Easiest way to replicate this is:

- have two repositories in the viewer on the left
- double click each of them to open them
- drag the second (right) tab to the left so that it becomes the first (left) tab
- close source tree
- reopen and the positions are now reversed again to the order they were initially opened

It should remember where it was when it was closed.
fields.summary: Repo tab order is not preserved after closing and reopening

fields.description:
SourceTree stores its configuration files in %LOCALAPPDATA% (ususally C:\Users\<user>\AppData\Local).

This is fine for none enterprise users. But in enterprise networks with Roaming User Profiles this folder is not synced or even cleared after logout/shutdown. This is very frustrating, because you lose registration data, configurations and everythind after every logout or switching the computer.

It would be better if important configuration files would be stored in %APPDATA% (usually C:\Users\<user>\AppData\Roaming or network drive). In this case, the configurations would be synchronized across the network.
fields.summary: Support for Windows Roaming User Profiles

fields.description:
h3. Summary
While selecting multiple lines using _Shift_ on SourceTree commit's diff (from bottom to top), it doesn't select all the lines correctly.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# open git project
# select a commit in Log / History to show the diff
# try to select multiple lines (From bottom to top) in the diff view using the shift key .

h3. Expected Results
 !ST-Select-line.gif! 

h3. Actual Results
All the lines are selected correctly
 
h3. Workaround
Use _Ctrl_ to select each line
fields.summary: Selecting text using 'shift' in the SourceTree diff view

fields.description:
On windows I was looking for a repository that was causing a Authenticate dialog box. Because the Authenticate box does not tell me which local git folder it causing the Authenticate dialog, the only way to find it is to look at them all. So manually I am using the keyboard shortcut to open the "Repository setting" dialog and then cannot click Esc to close it.

Please add:
# Repository details to the Authenticate Dialog
# Right click option to the Repository settings of a repository
# Esc to close any dialog box

Keep up the great work.
fields.summary: Esc key should close the Repository Settings dialog

fields.description: If there are any changed files, that were also moved to another location inside of a project - SourceTree can show differences for them, but for unknown reason "External diff" context menu item is disable for them.
fields.summary: External diff cannot be run on moved files

fields.description: I'm trying to push my project to bitbucket but the push window seems to be bugged. I've uninstalled and installed sourcetree, created other repositories and can't seem to find the error.
fields.summary: Push window doesn't show anything

fields.description:
When attempting to checkout remote branches from a gitlab repo, very often the application will get hung up. The "Log / History" panel will show "Loading...", and the new branch will not appear in the tree panel. If I try to checkout the same branch again, I will get the message "fatal: A branch named 'xxx' already exists'.

It is resolved by closing and restarting the app. F5, switching to other  repos, etc. seem to have no impact.

Thx for a great product.
fields.summary: Window hangs with "Loading..." in "Log / History" panel when switching branches
gdgdgg

fields.description:
Not sure this is a feature or a bug.. but I was able to create the second stash having the same name. See screenshot attached.
Then SourceTree is selecting them both and I cannot operate on them individually.
Thanks!
fields.summary: Created two git stashes having the same name

fields.description:
"split view staging" is not persistent.

Which means when I quit Source Tree I have to enable that for each repository I have open.

Wishes:
 * make "split view staging" persistent per repository
 * allow specifying a global default for "split view staging" that each un-configured repository gets when it has no explicit setting

This largely influences my workflow since the versions where the "split view staging" was still the default.

Changing this default cost a lot of work especially since I've to restart SourceTree half a dozen times a day because it keeps orphan git processes alive therefore consuming way too many resources (still need to reproduce this in a reliable way).
fields.summary: "split view staging" is not persistent

fields.description:
Allow user to have the ability to minimize and expand the commit message box which was implemented on SourceTree 1.8.3

UI from SourceTree 1.9.6.1
 !SourceTree1.9.6.1.PNG|thumbnail! 

UI from SourceTree 1.8.3
 !CommitMessageBox.gif!
fields.summary: Customer Request: Ability to minimize the commit message box

fields.description: I made 4 stash commits with the same name (my bad). Now while git easily discerns between each those 4 stashes, sourcetree treats them as one and gets only the latest stash. Assume this is a bug ? Else I am not getting the workflow to get to those stashes from sourcetree
fields.summary: Unable to discern between stashes with same name

fields.description: I did a cherry pick and got some merge conflicts. Unfortunately the diff window was useless since the red/green highlighting almost disappeared. Maybe
fields.summary: Missing red/green highlighting in diff window if merge conflicts are present

fields.description:
Launching the external merge tool results in three files on the format .merge_file_[id]

However, the arguments passed to the merge tool are on the format: ./[file-name]_[LOCAL|BASE|REMOTE]_.[ext]
fields.summary: External merge tool gets incorrect paths
Provide an option to sort the bookmarks view

fields.description: When looking at a staged file the Unstage Hunk button does not do anything
fields.summary: Unstage hunk not working

fields.description:
When viewing a staged file you can control+click to select multiple lines and then unstage them. 

In previous versions the lines were unstaged and the staged file remained in view. However since updating the view now changes to the recently unstaged lines.

The focus should remain on the staged file as you are likely to want to unstage further lines because discarding the changes completely.
fields.summary: Unstaging lines from file changes view

fields.description:
Hi,
Just to let you know: I've found that the entry excludesfile in .gitconfig was erased (after seeing some mess in a commit).
It seems that in SourceTree, if you touch some option without setting the "Global ignore list" in the Git tab (it comes empty by default) , it will overwrite the excludesfile you had in .gitconfig.
No problem now that it's updated but may be annoying.
Regards,
fields.summary: SourceTree erases the excludesfile entry in .gitconfig
